intro: Evolvulus helianthemifolius, commonly known as the sunflower leaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the morning and close by midday, hence its common name. Its leaves are typically lobed and resemble those of sunflowers, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
